00037 /*
00038 * Fork -- sends a copy of an incoming data object to each output. The
00039 * original data object is forwarded to the first output.
00040 * The data type should not matter, if the clone() method is defined
00041 * properly. This is just to test the clone() methods.
00042 *
00043 * Fork fork: NOUT=3,
00044 *   OUT=sink[1], sink[2], sink[3];
00045 * or (equivalent, if names follow a regular structure):
00046 * Fork fork: NOUT=3,
00047 *   OUT=(i: sink[i]);
00048 *   // NOUT: # of outputs
00049 *   // in case of a given counter variable (it has to be defined in advance),
00050 *   // output names are generated by the template given
00051 */
00052 #ifndef FORK_INCL
00053 #define FORK_INCL
00054 
00055 #include "inxout.h"
00056 
00057 //tolua_begin
00058 class dfork: public inxout {
00059   typedef inxout baseclass;
00060 
00061 public:
00062   dfork(void);
00063   ~dfork(void);
00064 
00065   int  noutp;
00066 //tolua_end
00067 
00068   rec_typ REC(data *, int); 
00069 
00070 }; //tolua_export
00071 #endif
00072
